Short Description: Public hearing regarding proposed disease control and disease reporting requirements
Meeting Location: Portland State Office Building: 800 NE Oregon St. Room 1B 97232
Details: The Oregon Health Authority, Public Health Division, Acute and Communicable Disease Prevention section is proposing to permanently amend rules in chapter 333, divisions 17, 18, 19 & 56 pertaining to new or modified definitions and to new disease reporting requirements. The new and modified definitions assure that Oregon’s definitions are harmonized with national definitions for lead poisoning and carbapenem antibiotic resistance, standardized in terms of laboratory specimen descriptors, and clarified with regard to defining syringes and excluding susceptible individuals in outbreak settings. The new disease reporting requirements include the addition of amebic infections of the central nervous system, coccidioidomycosis, and isolate-submission requirements for Coccidioides spp and novel influenza.

Short Description: Public hearing regarding proposed hospital satellite definition rule amendments
Meeting Location: Portland State Office Building; 800 NE Oregon St. Room 1E
Details: The Oregon Health Authority, Public Health Division, Health Care Regulation and Quality Improvement section is proposing to permanently amend administrative rules in chapter 333, divisions 500 and 525 relating to hospitals. Treating persons in psychiatric crisis continues to be an issue for hospitals, health systems and community-based organizations. The proposed ‘satellite’ definition change will allow a hospital or health system more flexibility to set up psychiatric emergency services in a more efficient and patient centered way and possibly reduce the number of psychiatric patients waiting for care in an emergency department. The overall goal is to provide an opportunity for improved care and prompt access to psychiatric emergency services and inpatient psychiatric care as needed.

Short Description: The Committee will further discuss proposed rule changes regarding Service Area Changes for Existing CCOs and MCOs; and OHA Dispute Resolution for CCOs and MCOs
Meeting Location: Barbara Roberts Human Services Building, 500 Summer St NE, Room 137 CD
Details:
410-141-3040 and 410-141-0040 (Service Area Changes for Existing CCOs and MCOs) - The rules provide a consistent framework for existing CCOs and MCOs electing to apply to OHA for service area expansion, once OHA has stated that it has a need for network and capacity in a given service area. They provide for the service area expansion process, the review tool and mechanism, and a means for CCO and MCO dispute, should a CCO or MCO not agree with the application review findings or process.

410-141-3267 and 410-141-0267 (CCO/MCO/OHA Dispute Resolution) - The rules provide direction and clarification as an avenue of recourse for CCOs and MCOs when in dispute with OHA. These rules direct CCOs and MCOs to the administrative review process as identified in OAR 410-120-1580.
